Help Text: Indicate if the homeowner communicated with you that they do not wish to proceed with the project
Define the home type (e.g. single-story, two-story, etc.). This helps determine accessibility and the installation approach.
Contact your supervisor if there is no layout provided
Indicate if any solar panels are planned for installation on structures other than the main roof (e.g. garage, carport, pergola, ground mount).
Record the type of roofing material present (e.g. composition shingle tile, metal, TPO, etc). This determines the appropriate mounting hardware and installation method.

Question Label: Is the main panel or subpanel inside the home?
Help Text: Confirm the location of the main service panel or subpanel. If inside the home additional coordination with the homeowner may be needed for access during installation.
Identify the brand of the main electrical service panel (e.g. Square D, Siemens, GE, Eaton). This is important for selecting compatible breakers and equipment.
Record the amperage rating of the main breaker (e.g. 100A, 200A, 400A). This determines the available capacity for the solar system interconnection.
Document the bus bar rating of the main service panel (typically 100A, 125A, 200A, 225A, or 400A).
Verify if the grounding electrode conductor bond to the cold water pipe is visible and accessible. This is required by NEC for proper system grounding.
Measure and record the pitch of the steepest roof section where panels will be installed. This affects safety requirements and installation difficulty.
Determine if conduit or wiring needs to be run through the attic space. If unknown note for further investigation during installation.
Record the capacity any battery storage system proposed (e.g. Tesla Powerwall 13.5 kWh or Enphase IQ 10). Input 'N/A' if no battery is included.
Indicate if aerial imaging via Scanifly or similar technology is needed for roof measurements and shading analysis.
Confirm that all required site survey photos have been uploaded to the project management system (roof, electrical panel, proposed equipment locations etc.).
Enter the date the site survey was conducted.
Record total hours the installation team was on site for this visit, from the moment the crew arrived until they departed for the day.
Confirm that the approved building permit is physically present at the job site and posted as required by local code.
Verify that the actual installation matches the approved permit plans. If 'No' you must explain the discrepancy in the next field.
If the installation does not match the approved plans provide a detailed explanation of what differs and why (e.g. roof obstruction found, change order approved etc.).
Estimate the number of additional hours needed to complete the installation. This helps with scheduling and resource allocation.
Confirm that all exposed conduit on the roof has been painted to match the roof color or as specified in the installation standards.
Verify that all exterior electrical conduit on ground level or lower floors has been painted according to specifications and local aesthetic requirements.
Confirm that all set screws on ground mount racking systems are properly tightened to manufacturer specifications. Select 'No' if this is a roof mount system.
Confirm that the homeowner has been given a complete walkthrough of the system including operation, monitoring shutdown procedures, and maintenance requirements.
Verify that all installation debris, packaging materials, and excess materials have been removed from the property and the site has been left clean.
Confirm that all DC wiring from the solar array has been properly run and terminated.
Provide additional details about the DC wire run status. If incomplete specify what work remains.
Confirm that all solar modules have been physically installed on the mounting planes.
Indicate if any roof tiles were damaged during installation and need replacement. Document approximate number and location if 'Yes'.
Provide details about module installation status. If incomplete specify how many modules remain and any issues encountered.
Confirm that grounding electrode system (ground rods) has been installed per NEC requirements. Select 'NA' if existing grounding is adequate.
Provide details about grounding electrode installation including number of rods, location, depth, and bonding method.
Verify that all electrical equipment (inverter, disconnect, load center, battery etc.) has been mounted and all conduit has been installed.

Question Label: Electrical Equipment Hung and Piped Info
Help Text: Provide details about electrical equipment installation status. If incomplete specify which equipment remains or what work is needed.
Confirm that all AC wiring from the inverter to the point of interconnection (main panel or load center) has been completed and terminated.
Provide details about AC wire run. If incomplete specify what remains (e.g. wire pulling, terminations, interconnection).
Record the serial number of all inverters. This is critical for warranty registration and system monitoring setup.

Question Label: DC Wire Run to Roof J-Box
Help Text: Confirm that DC wiring from modules has been run to the roof junction box or combiner and properly terminated.

Question Label: DC Wire Run to Roof J-Box Info
For Select there would be 'AnswerOption': DC Wire Run to Roof J-Box List
Help Text: Provide details about DC wiring to junction box. Specify number of strings wire sizing and any issues if incomplete.
Verify that all required NEC labels have been placed including: solar system warning labels, rapid shutdown labels, DC/AC disconnect labels, and directory labels.
Provide details about labeling. If incomplete specify which labels are missing or need correction.
Confirm that all module-level power electronics (optimizers or microinverters) are communicating and all strings are producing expected voltage.

Question Label: All Strings Working Opt Rep Info
Help Text: Provide details about string/optimizer status. If issues exist document which optimizers are not reporting and troubleshooting steps taken.

Question Label: Was Monitoring Set Up And Tested On The Inverter(s)
Help Text: Confirm that system monitoring has been configured and tested including data connection and that production data is being transmitted to the monitoring platform.

Question Label: Monitoring Set Up & Tested Invert Info
Help Text: Provide details about monitoring setup. Include monitoring platform connection method (WiFi/Ethernet/cellular) and verification that data is appearing correctly.
List all installation team members present on site for this installation. Include names and roles.

Question Label: Was A Line Side Tap Completed
Help Text: Indicate if a supply-side (line-side) tap was performed to connect the solar system before the main breaker.
Indicate if the main breaker was derated (reduced in amperage rating) to accommodate the solar system backfeed per the 120% rule.

Question Label: Was A Hawaiian Tie In Complete
Help Text: Indicate if a Hawaiian-style interconnection was completed.

Question Label: Was a Meter Collar Adaptor completed?
Help Text: Indicate if a meter collar adapter was installed.
Enter the date when the installation or this phase of work occurred.
